The data are available at different levels of granularity: admin area level 1 (administrative area of top level, usually countries), admin area level 2 (usually states, regions, cantons), admin area level 3 (usually cities, municipalities). 

**Pre-processed data** are obtained by filling missing dates in the raw data with `NA` values. This ensures that all locations share the same grid of dates and no single day is skipped. Then, `NA` values are replaced with the previous non-`NA` value or `0`.

**Policies** for admin areas level 2 and 3 **are inherited** from national-level policies by [Oxford Covid-19 Government Response Tracker](https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker) using [flags](https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker/blob/master/documentation/codebook.md). National-level policies applied across the whole country (flag=1) are propagated to levels 2 and 3. **Subnational policies** for level 2 are available for the countries listed in the [Subnational Data section](https://github.com/OxCGRT/covid-policy-tracker#subnational-data). Since 2020-12-12, **US policies** for admin areas level 3 (counties) are inherited from the policies available for admin areas level 2 (states).

The **datasets** are updated on an hourly basis. The workflow takes around one hour to process the data worldwide and the release takes place only when all the datasets are ready. This means there is usually between 1h and 2h lag with respect to the data provider. 

See the [dataset documentation](/articles/doc/data.html) and [changelog](/news/index.html).

## Vintage Data

```{r, include=FALSE}
start <- as.Date("2020-04-14")
end   <- Sys.Date()-2
dates <- seq(end, start, by = -1)
tab   <- sprintf("| https://storage.covid19datahub.io/%s.zip | Dataset snapshot (vintage) | %s | ZIP | ![](https://storage.covid19datahub.io/downloads/%s.zip.svg) |", dates, dates, dates)
tab   <- paste0(tab, collapse = "\n")
```
